data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Added VS2017 support in project files
data.body: Added VS2017 support in the project files, since loading a project in VS2017 doesn't automatically select the right build tools (it kept defaulting to VS2010).

data.title: Change library/header search paths of external libraries for tvOS.
data.body:
Currently `libcocos2d tvOS` throws warnings when compiling for the simulator and errors when compiling for devices. These errors are due to the external libraries being linked having been compiled for iOS instead of tvOS.

This PR fixes those errors and allows cocos2d games to be run on physical tvOS devices. It requires tvOS libraries added in [PR #286 of cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin/pull/286).

data.title: use different separator on different platforms and make path length short
Sprite3D not clipped to bounds in ScrollView or TableView cell.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: V 3.13
- devices test on: iPhone 6
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 8.x

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a Sprite3D node to a table cell in a TableView.
2. Scroll the table and the 3D node is not clipped to the bounds.

data.title: Path issue in build.gradle
data.body:
Currently the build.gradle uses path string like
```
arguments 'NDK_MODULE_PATH=../../../..:../../../../cocos:../../../../external'
```

there are two issues:
* use `:` to separator paths, it can not work on windows, should use `;` on windows
* there is too many `..` in path which will easily meet path length limitation on windows

data.title: Running Liquid Action on NodeGrid changes appearance of nodes to a black hue/tint
data.body:
cocos2d-x v3.14
Iphone 5s, Samsung Tab E
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 11.2.2725575
   - 8.2.1
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create NodeGrid
2. Create Liquid Action
3. add some Button images with transparency and with `setTouchEnabled()` to the node grid
4. run liquid action
5. add NodeGrid to a rendering layer 
6. run app and click on the last button you added
7. result = changes all other Buttons to black

data.title: Could new implement of AssetsManagerEx support how many bytes need to download, and how many bytes downloaded in dispatchUpdateEvent?
data.body:
I think ```AssetsManagerEx``` need 3 more feature(because the ```project.manifest``` has been can provide size field) 
1. after download new ```project.manifest``` and detach a event tell user how many bytes we need to download this update, and decide whether to download or not. if yes, then call ```AssetsManagerEx::startUpdate()```
2. detach ```UPDATE_PROGRESSION``` event need know how many we had downloadedand what is total need to download.
3. new added functions in ```AssetsManagerEx``` need to export js/lua to use.
  ```getMaxConcurrentTask```, ```setMaxConcurrentTask```, ```setVersionCompareHandle```, ```setVerifyCallback```

:

```AssetsManagerEx```3```project.manifest```size
1. ```project.manifest``````AssetsManagerEx::startUpdate()```

2. ```UPDATE_PROGRESSION```````````````
3. ```AssetsManagerEx```js/lua 
  ```getMaxConcurrentTask```, ```setMaxConcurrentTask```, ```setVersionCompareHandle```, ```setVerifyCallback```

 
@pandamicro

data.title: Updates PR #17476 (Remove _claimedTouches Flags for listeners)
data.body:
PR #17476
Uses range loop for clearing claimed touches in the next touch begin event.

Image We have two sprite squares, A (Left) and square B(Right), A is above of B, Both A and B have one by one touch listeners, and it will not swallow touches.

Click at the intersection of A and B, do not move
Touch press
A - onTouchBegan, return true, listener->_claimedTouches is true for A
B - onTouchBegan, return true, listener->_claimedTouches is true for B
Touch release
A - onTouchEnded, we manually call event->stopPropagation() in the onTouchEnd function !!! listener->_claimedTouches is cleared
B - Because A stopPropagation, listener->_claimedTouches is not cleared

In this case, Because A stop propagation for touch end, the listener->_claimedTouches for B will not be cleared forever ! because B has touch begin, which record the touch in listener->_claimedTouches, but it has not touch end !

[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Impossible Dependency in setCenterRectNormalized
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1 (downloaded from website)
- devices test on: (simulator iOS 10)
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version: 8.2.1
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Call setCenterRectNormalized in default RenderMode::POLYGON mode with the intent of switching to RenderMode::SLICE9 mode (this is currently the only function that will set _renderMode to RenderMode::SLICE9.
2. Function returns immediately because it depends on being in QUAD or SLICE9 mode already.

Seems to me since the function is capable of switching into SLICE9 mode, it should be fine to enter it from POLYGON mode.
